name: Aopala Banerjee
tagline: A Happy Enabler and A Bit of Everything
summary: A dancer by training, life’s gentle progress shifted my interest towards Performance Arts & Films, at an early age of 16. At the International Art Caravan, initiated by Inder Salim, I presented my first collaborative Performance Art Piece. Life’s leaf turning to High School and College, my will towards Performance Art grew. I’ve since worked in many a spontaneous and collaborative project, becoming a part of the Performance Art movement in Kolkata with Performers Independent. A short break later, my work as a dancer/performer has taken new forms, having been privileged enough to be part of Artistic Platforms like Think Arts, Pickle Factory and Dung Beetle Films.

work_1.name: Touch
work_1.desc: "Touch" Conceptualized by Niharika Senapati and Pippa Samaya is a short dance film capturing idea of trauma, touch and tenderness through movement. This work is produced by Pickle Factory and Asia-Arts as part of an Art Residency sharing.

work_2.name: Into the Daydreaming
work_2.desc: The performance incorporates music and dance, as well as dreamlike lighting in strong hues and is purposefully created where parents and child can be at ease and yet, trigger a baby’s sensorial and kinesthetic senses at the same time. Interlacing contemporary dance, music and visual arts within an immersive, installation-based environment, Into the Daydreaming is a sensorially saturated experience and proposes an exceptional encounter with the arts. This new-age performance has been conceptualized and directed by DALIJA ACIN THELANDER, one of the leading choreographers from Sweden.

work_3.name: An Act of Resistance
work_3.desc:
"An Act of Resistance" is a site specific, interactive performance art piece where the performer urges every one to create a minimal "Act" of resistance.
This work was first performed at Kolkata International Performance Art Festival 2017.

work_4.name: Choukath
work_4.desc:
"Choukath/Threshold" is Playback Project from Satyajit Ray Film and Television Institute directed by Moinak Biswas.
This work is a mix of Music, Contemporary Dance and Fictional Visual about a forbidden land which is incidentally one of the most intensely militarized zone in the world having one armed force for every 15 citizen.

work_5.name: Khyapa
work_5.desc: Khyapa/Pariah directed by Riddhi Majumder. Pariah won the best film award at KAZCHA - NIV Independent Film Festival. Picture by Abhirup Halder.
